data.title: Great beginner set!
data.body:
My twins were taking an interest in music, so I knew I had to get them an instrument for their 8th birthday. I looked at so many keyboards and had the hardest time choosing between this set and a Casio keyboard.
Honestly, this just seemed like a cheap set, while the Casio has touch response keys, which make it more similar to a real piano. Although the Casio was more expensive, I almost got that, but in the end, I chose Rock Jam and am very satisfied.
This comes with everything you need! Keyboard, stand, bench, headphones, and sustain pedal. I think the sound is great! It's so easy for my daughters to use and I got them a few piano books, so they're really enjoying it. They're true beginners, but have been playing every day, and in just a few days, they could play some simple Christmas songs. It's a wonderful hobby and so great for their little minds. My 3 year old loves to sit down and play too!
Down the road, I might buy the Casio, but for now, this set is perfect for learning and it was affordable, so we're very happy with it. :)

data.title: Nice set up for kids
data.body: I got this for my 12 year old daughter. She isn‚Äôt trained but likes to play and her old keyboard finally broke after 5 years. This one is pretty nice. The stand and bench are both very sturdy although adults should be careful on the bench. The stands height adjustment is easily done. There are straps to secure the keyboard to the stand so it can‚Äôt be accidentally knocked off although the low overall weight of the entire assembly feels like it might get pushed over so we opted to place it against the wall. The music holder is not attached so that might be an issue if it comes off it could get broken. I actually didn‚Äôt realize it came with headphones so that was a wonderful surprise-she can play and we can still watch tv since it‚Äôs in the living room. There‚Äôs a plug for a microphone too. Assembly took maybe 10 minutes. Very pleased with it. Daughter loves it so that‚Äôs all that matters

data.title: Great Keyboard But Here Are Some Things To Consider
data.body:
I bought this as a Christmas gift for my 13-yr-old and have been very happy! I'd like to point out some things that I think might be helpful for those considering buying it:

1) The picture on Amazon is a little misleading. At first glance, it looks as if there is a large display on the top of the keyboard showing the piano learning application/notes to be played. If you look closer, you'll realize it's a tablet sitting on the top of the keyboard, showing the app. The "display" feature mentioned in the product description is a small display directly above the keyboard. Obviously, the piano doesn't come with a tablet included. I knew this when I purchased the keyboard but I think it's worth pointing out. My kid has used his iphone propped on top of the keyboard to play the application so he can learn piano. It works okay. The notes can be a little hard to see at times, but it's not that bad. If you use your tablet to run a piano lesson application, it would be a lot easier probably but using the phone is still doable.

2) This set comes with earphones. This is great! However, be aware that the "Simply Piano" application requires NO headphones because it has to "listen" to the piano being played to advance to the next level or lesson. I don't know if all of the piano apps require this but I didn't think about it when I purchased the keyboard. My kid can use the headphones when he's goofing around on the keyboard, but whenever he wants to use the app to learn, he has to use it without headphones. (I hear him play and practice, which is both a fun upside and a noisy downside. lol)

3) There are A LOT of buttons so the keyboard looks very complicated. I think this keyboard is a great buy for beginners interested in learning piano. My kid has really enjoyed it. There are a lot of features & functions. It's a little intimidating at first glance, but most of it is pretty intuitive. There are record & play back functions to play back what you've been playing, which my kid really likes. The are buttons to change the sound/instrument or rhythm. I didn't see any point in overwhelming my kid by going through every description of every button in the manual, but he's had fun exploring & figuring out what each button does on his own.

4) What I love most about this keyboard is how much fun he has been having with music. The "Simply Piano" application has been good and the keyboard itself has been exactly what I wanted. In my opinion it's a very good value at this price if you're interested in learning to play the piano/keyboard.

data.title: Comes with a damper/sustain pedal but no microphone
data.body:
My piano kit arrived sooner than expected. I‚Äôm happy with the performance and appearance. The sound quality is good enough for me‚Äîan improvement compared to my old Lowrey keyboard from 20+ years ago. The keys of this keyboard feel more like a real piano‚Äôs compared to my old Lowrey. I chose this Rockjam piano because it came with a damper/sustain pedal (I didn‚Äôt need the microphone that most other electric pianos come with), and I liked that the stand has built-in holes for thumb screws (included) to screw the stand into the piano. Unfortunately, the stand was disappointingly wobbly and not sturdy. It looks like other electric piano keyboards being sold on Amazon have a similar flimsy stand. I screwed the Rockjam piano into my old (heavier, sturdier) Lowrey stand, and that works for me.

Dimension info:
The sheet music holder is 16.75 inches long. That‚Äôs longer than most on the market, but I wish it was even longer.
The stand to hold up the piano is 32.5 inches long. It is of adjustable height ranging from 20.5 to 31.5 inches. It is less than 5 pounds.

data.title: Used not in my opinion
data.body: It was definitely more than worth the price it was used so I expected some dents some imperfections. Yet the only thing that seemed use was the box . Everything else down to the headphones seats is all in my opinion in amazing condition and the lessons are amazingly helpful

data.title: Complete, easy to set up, fun
data.body: Previously purchased a piano-style keyboard for my grandson, but carrying it around to use it wherever he could find space resulted in some mishaps. Still, he wants to learn music so I decided to try again. He loves this new set-up as much as his parents do. It was easy to go from the box to ready-to-play. Good fun. Good sound! Good buy!

data.title: 6 years and counting: Break a leg!
data.body:
Purchased in 2017 to teach my kids music. They didn't ever have patience. Now and then they'd turn it on to fool around and then listen to presets.

Enter, 2023. I put it on the stand in the basement. It's got two keys that no longer stick. The batteries, I don't think I ever needed to replace them. I have no idea where the cord wandered off to...?

This is a great kids music tool for beginners and just in general for child creative content. I love that it can be set up and they choose whether to play with it or not. My one kid has learned some presets by ear by now and enjoys playing by ear though he has also learned to read music by now. We are using the Accent on Achievement series.

I might replace it with the same device if the keys get any worse, I think they probably were rougher on it as younger kiddos. It's a good learning device and a childhood of entertainment if your kids are careful enough.

We also bought or made little piano key stickers. Buy it, and break a leg, not the bank!

data.title: This is a toy.
data.body: Not really good from my perspective for someone who wants to learn to play piano. Key action is not good. It's electronic so you have to make the connection - key to connection. Up near the top of the key you will find it not connecting. But, for a kid who wants to pay, it's fine.

data.title: Good for beginners
data.body: I used to play piano when I was much younger. We had a large piano in our living room that I would play around on, but nothing serious. Then we moved and left it behind. My wife suggested I buy a keyboard for my office and learn to play again, and I agreed. I looked at a lot of reviews and decided on this purchase because it came with a stand, stool, and headphones. It also included stickers for the keys for beginners. The sound is close to piano, but not quite, which annoys me. The range is not good at all, and after some playing, I decided to stay on the lower end of the piano because if you go above middle C, the notes become very shrill. I play along to songs I like, and the tone does not match perfectly. For learning, it has been great, but I am now looking to upgrade to a better-sounding keyboard. If the volume is too loud, I have noticed that the speakers have a rattle in them. I don't play very loud often, but when I want to show off to my wife, it is a little embarrassing. Overall, I'm happy with the product and would purchase it again if I was in the same mindset.

data.title: I would purchase again!
data.body: Excellent product with an excellent price point! I would purchase this again! Gave it as a gift to someone and it has been used extensively.

data.title: Good Keyboard, Unfortunate Stand
data.body:
Play Video
The keyboard itself is your standard, starter keyboard. It's good for anyone looking to start learning a new skill. Does is sound like a baby grand piano? No. Should you expect it to? Also no. I purchased it for my spouse for the holiday and they enjoy it. The free 30 days of the app/course is a nice addition. The fact that it has headphones is nice, but you may struggle to learn from your phone/ipad/tablet *and* hear the piano through the headphones, so just keep that in mind. You need to be able to hear the notes and lessons on the app, which is a bit challenging with the headphones on and connected to the piano.
My major issue is how wobbly the stand is. This isn't user assembly error and it isn't wobbly floors. It wiggles quite a bit, to the point that it is distracting while trying to play. The keyboard does kind of "mount" to the stand (it's two straps and two screws that go into the bottom of the keyboard, but there's probably about 4" of movement available), but the wobble is concerning.
I contacted both Amazon customer service and the RockJam customer service (Per Amazon's instructions), so TBD if there is resolution to the wobbly stand.

data.body: My 4 year old recently became super interested in pianos/keyboards, so we bought him this. He has been non stop playing on it. I love that it can be battery powered or wire connection. Perfect height & comfy chair. He loves it so much.

data.title: Very good for the price
data.body:
The 61 key electric keyboard is a versatile and compact instrument perfect for beginners and experienced musicians alike. With its streamlined design and lightweight construction, this keyboard is perfect for both home use and transportation to gigs or rehearsals. The 61 keys provide enough range to play most pieces of music, making it suitable for a wide variety of musical styles and genres.

The instrument features a range of sounds and effects, including various piano tones, as well as strings, organs, and synthesizer sounds. This allows musicians to experiment and create a diverse range of musical styles, making the keyboard suitable for both solo performances and ensemble playing.

The keyboard also includes built-in metronome and recording features, providing essential tools for practice and songwriting. Additionally, the instrument has connectivity options for headphones and external audio devices, making it easy to practice silently or to play along with backing tracks.

Overall, the 61 key electric keyboard is an excellent choice for musicians looking for a versatile and portable instrument. Its affordable price point and user-friendly features make it a great option for anyone looking to learn, practice, or perform music.

We had so much fun on Christmas Eve playing ‚ÄúJingle Bells‚Äù and using the recording feature.

Considering the money, this product, complete with headphones, pedal and stool, is a good deal. However, the music stand is very unsteady, when playing, it shakes with every note. In addition, because the weight, (either a music book or iPad), it causes the electric jack making loud electricity sound. Initially, I tried to unplug and replug in, the sound can go away for a while, then it comes back. Then I discovered it was the weight as after I put my iPad or book elsewhere, the sound is gone.
Maybe there is a defect in the one I have received.

data.title: A very nice keyboard for beginners!
data.body: The keyboard was easy to put together. For me personally, the seat is too small and is not adjustable. I love the sticky keys that show you where each note is! The different tones, rhythms and percussion sounds are quite nice for a keyboard this size. As an experienced pianist and organist (43 years), this instrument is worth the money, but I believe the protection plan is also a good investment ... just in case! Would I buy it again? Yes, I would. This one will be used in the church where I belong ....

data.body: My keyboard was just delivered today. I was afraid that since I am older, with health issues I would not be able to put it together by myself. I found it pretty easy actually. I started practicing right away. I am not a good pianist, I took lessons when I was a child, so I didn't need anything high end. I just wanted to learn to play some old songs from my youth. I was very, very pleased with the sound quality. I have not had time to try out all the features, but I am just glad I can practice piano again. I love it!

data.title: Good for Price
data.body:
Play Video
In my opinion only suitable for a child or perhaps a very beginner adult. Sound quality is OK. The stand is not steady - first time I put a music book on the stand it tipped backwards. The headphones are cheesy and the foam cover on earpiece came off first time my 5 year old wore them. But does work with other plug-in headphones. Overall I think good price for all included - keyboard, stand, bench, and headphones. We purchased a microphone separately and that plugs into keyboard. Everything came packaged well.

data.title: Meh
data.body:
Great piece of hardware. Nice sized keyboard. Is functional as a piano completely. An alrght beginner piano, maybe better for intermediate as it is.
I remember when you could get a keyboard for similar quality with better beginner features that actually would allow you to play along with the songs on it.
When playing "play-along" songs to learn keys, the screen is diffult to see what keys are being played partly because of the angle and clarity but mostly because it doesn't accurately depict what keys are playing as it goes. It doesn't activate keys on the screen to tell you what is being played.

data.title: Product quality
data.body: Exactly what I was looking for. Top quality merchandise.

data.title: a great starting for a beginer
data.body:
I have used this for last 4months to learn to play piano.
I purchased the app for 100 + for a year subscription also and now I can play some basics.
A very easy to learn and play with an affordable price and I am truly thankful.
The only thing I am not little disappointed is sometimes the app doesn't recognized the right note I am playing, especially the lower keys with left hand and it makes me little frustrated. And that is why I am not giving a five stars for the sound quality.

data.title: Very cool
data.body: This thing is awesome, my kiddos are learning to lay however the headphones stopped working about an hour into it.

data.title: Embarrassing
data.body:
I do not understand all of the positive reviews. If I were still in the return window and if my husband hadn't thrown away the packaging, I would definitely return this because it is the worst-sounding keyboard I have ever heard. My toddler has Baby Einstein toys that sound better than this.

I am a voice teacher and I needed to purchase a decent keyboard so that I could teach over Zoom while I was traveling to my parents out of state. With all of the positive reviews and for a $110 investment, I figured this wouldn't be as good as what I'm used to but it would do the job of allowing me to continue teaching smooth lessons‚ÄîI'm not a great pianist to begin with, so literally all I need it to do is play block chords and not sound ridiculous. First of all, the default volume setting is the loudest setting. This means that if you have a toddler running around turning the keyboard on and off, no matter how low you set the volume, it's always going to be ridiculously loud when it turns back on. It also means that when the keyboard keeps on periodically turning off while you are teaching (?!) you have to adjust the volume again.

Secondly, there is a huge variety of sounds available, but unfortunately none of them actually sound ANYTHING like a piano. The setting that they designate as piano is just atrocious. I have used different sounds like marimba while teaching my voice lessons because it's a little less jarring and it makes my young students laugh. I work with some professional-level students and I feel self conscious telling them that I have to use marimba or another sound so their ears don't bleed.

The other big problem is that when I play a chord on this keyboard, sometimes the sound cuts out and turns back on again very loudly! It's jarring and embarrassing for me when this happens. I feel very unprofessional and flustered when I teach on this keyboard. I could have just used my kid's toy piano from Melissa and Doug and I would have felt more confident.

data.title: If you are serious about learning piano look elsewhere.
data.body:
Listen. I liked the price. That's why I bought this. I decided that "hey i'm not a master piano player and i just want to learn so something not so expensive won't hurt me." however if you speak to anyone and i do mean ANYONE who is at any skill level over an absolute beginner in piano they will tell you that there are several things that are needed to to learn piano correctly. You may say, as i did, "that sounds like gatekeeping bullhonkey and they just want you to spend a ton of money on a not-necessary keyboard." However through my own experience. Talking to experienced piano players and through testing of my own on various types of pianos that i could touch for free i learned that it was not bullhonkey.

Let me start with the most important feature of a keyboard meant to be learned how to play an actual piano on. It needs to have all the keys a regular piano would have. That means 88 keys. You'll notice this product does not have that.

Second is that it has what's called "dynamic sound." i was confused by this term but it basically means if you play a key hard the sound is louder. If you play it soft the sound is quieter. This keyboard does not have that.

Third is weighted keys. "oh god why would i need weighted keys that sounds like a way to hike up the price for no reason." let me assure you i tested this out. the best explanation i got out of piano teachers was "it doesn't feel like a real piano." and i am not one to just blindly follow what somebody else tells me so before i returned this item i went around my community and found several different types of keyboards and actual pianos ranging from this keyboard to a semi-weighted keyboard, a fully weighted keyboard and actual baby grand piano's and upright pianos. Weighted keys matter because if the keys don't resist you comparatively similarly to a real keyboard you will ingrain bad habits that are a NIGHTMARE to unlearn.

you might be sitting here saying "this is all i can afford what am i supposed to do." Listen i get it. Pandemic hit us all hard financially. my advice? go to the used market. find an 88 key weighted keyboard used. I ended up finding an old OLD model of weighted key keyboard with a key not working and the piano expert i talked to said it would STILL be better than this thing. I paid 150 for that. Think about that. I got an expert approved keyboard that was from 1989 that was supposed to work better for learning piano than this thing.

Now listen. If you are just getting this thing for your kids to bang away on or for the fun electronic recording features and/or you just want to learn to play a specific, easy song on the piano then i'd say feel free to buy this one. If you want to seriously learn piano by being self-taught (which is totally valid) or you have a kid who is earnest in wanting to play piano then don't buy this keyboard the damage it will do to their learning is NOT worth the admittedly awesome price.

data.title: Disappointed: Okay keyboard for kids, DO NOT RECOMMEND for experienced players
data.body: I would not recommend this keyboard to any prospective buyer. I haven‚Äôt made a review before but felt compelled to do so for this product. It is not worth the money. It is a small keyboard with only 32 keys, although it is advertised as 61. You can get a far better keyboard on Amazon with just a little extra cost. This keyboard should be advertised towards kids starting their piano learning. The height of the chair and the numbers of keys is limited just for beginners. It only comes with 5 octaves. The Bass is uncomfortably loud, to the point that it becomes unbalanced and masks the Soprano. You can barely hear the melody, when playing with your right hand as the higher notes get swamped in the lows. Although the keyboard is electronic and not hammered, the keys are very slippery under your fingers and not close to the acoustic sound of a piano in comparison to the other keyboards of similar price ranges. The volume adjustment varies a lot by just one level change, yet the quietest volume on the keyboard can still be very loud.

data.title: great for beginners

This piano keyboard is great for beginners.The sound is not as good as the expensive ones (don‚Äôt expect too much,you get what you pay for)but its good enough if you‚Äôre a beginner or not sure if playing piano is what you want.
It‚Äôs a good deal because you will get 6 weeks of free simply piano app tutorials.

data.title: stand comes unevrn
data.body:
Play Video
the stand is uneven

data.title: Great set & great price
data.body:
STAND: I feel the stand works quit well. Once you have everything tightened and the key board actually attached to it, it all feels very sturdy. I love that it is adjustable in height. I purchased this for my 5 yr old, (although it can be used for an adult as well), and the adjustable stand brought the keyboard down to just the right height for her. (it goes pretty low to normal height)
SEAT: is not adjustable, but since the stand is, so it doesn't matter. The seat is a bit small. It's probably fine for a very small adult and children. But if you are an average to larger size person like me, then you will want to purchase the piano separately and get a larger keyboard/piano bench.
HEADPHONES: not a very good quality. They crackle at times. I use a child's headphone set because it limits the volume output.
LCD SCREEN: Is nice. If you want to know what a key is, you just press the key and it shows up on the grand staff on the screen. But I use sticker notes for my daughter, and you can see them better. Nice to have a built in metronome.
CON: (-1 star) Every time you turn the keyboard on, the default volume is max, and you have to adjust it. I don't see a place where I can change this to default to a lower setting. My casio turns down extremely low, and when I turn it off, the next time I use it, it is still at the volume I left it on. I wish that is how this one was.
KEYS: I find these keys are stiffer than my Casio keys. I was worried about my 5yr old being able to use them, but she seems to do fine with them, so they must not be that stiff.
OVERALL: great set & great price for a beginner.

data.title: Just ok
data.body: The keyboard arrived with a cord that did not work.

data.title: Good beginner piano- tiny bit out of tune
data.body:
Not for anything besides some basic music note practice and messing around with some tunes. Not for serious piano lessons. The standard piano track is just a bit out of tune that regular piano users will notice it and immediately find annoying. I don‚Äôt play that often, and it annoys me- a little bit.

I used to play when I was younger- and with the availability of sheet music online and video lessons on YouTube- anyone can get into music now. Practice makes perfect! Or in my case- acceptable music. Lol.

It‚Äôs cheap, and if you can work with it‚Äôs out of tune sounds- it‚Äôs enough for you to practice with. Again, it‚Äôs not terribly out of tune, but it is. Have fun!

data.title: Very nice keyboard
data.body:
Purchased for granddaughter and she really likes it. She playrd me something and its a good thing it came with a two week lessons. She is taking keyboard lessons in school now. Nice keyboard, the microphone
and chair for such a great price for a starter Thank you.

data.title: Not for kids
data.body: It has a sustain button. Not sure the sustain pedal is necessary unless you‚Äôre using this for professional purposes. The speakers sound like they‚Äôre wearing out a bit but it‚Äôs been abused by 3 year olds so I don‚Äôt blame the machinery for that just know it‚Äôs no match.

data.title: Cheaper option, good quality
data.body: It feels cheap, it is cheaper, but it works just fine and no issues with it. It‚Äôs lightweight which is good for moving it around

data.title: Not what I thought I was ordering.
data.body: Too much noise. Too many combinations.

data.title: Gift
data.body: My granddaughter loves it she was surprised and happy to get it

data.title: Good starter
data.body: Good starter keyboard for a beginner

data.title: Great buy
data.body: My Goddaughter loved this. Great sound. Easy set up.

data.title: Love it and love that it came with removable note stickers for the keys.
data.body: Very fun!!! I recommend the keyboard but don't recommend the learn to play app that came with it, though it may of been due to my phone. If you have trouble with the learn to play app there's plenty of helpful videos on YouTube.

data.title: It's pretty good beginner keyboard
data.body:
My daughter has been slowly getting into music the last year or so. She wanted to graduate from the little bitty toy one that she had. And after hours of searching I decided to pick this one.
With everything the keyboard to do itself was great and on top of that it came with a stool and stand for the keyboard itself and a music/ tablet holder...
Even though my daughter chose to just take the keyboard let me know I could keep the rest of it....haha
But I thought it was a really cool package, great for a beginner.

data.title: Great for my 8yo.
data.body: If you‚Äôre trying to play a concert this isn‚Äôt for you. This is a starter keyboard for a child. Has the standard ‚Äúpingy‚Äù sound. He loves it, is learning to play, and I don‚Äôt have to worry about him or his friend breaking a $2000 keyboard so win win.

data.title: Good materials, it's practical
data.body:
Play Video
It's good for my kids , I'm also starting to learning here piano.

data.title: Good gift
data.body: Grandson loves it

data.title: NOT the best quality
data.body: My daughter loved this keyboard, and all the features it offers, unfortunately, she only enjoyed it for a month before it went haywire, and stopped working altogether. Never even got to start the lessons that were part of the package.

data.title: Great for budding musicians!
data.body: I bought this for my granddkids (ages 10, 9 &7). They are really enjoying it. It is easy to use and comes with everything they need to start to learn some basic songs. The headphones are an added plus as they can play and practice without the extra noise disturbing the peace of your home. I feel that the reasonable price is well worth the possibility of inspiring our next great composer. Music is good for the soul and is an excellent source to help kids and adults relax and enjoy the calmer, melodic side of life. I like playing this instrument, too! I definitely recommend this kekyboard.

data.title: Great Beginner Keyboard/Piano! (1 year review)
data.body:
Play Video
My son had had this for a year and absolutely loves it! It has held up and is a quality beginner keyboard! We had to use new headphones as the original ones broke.
